text: Kanpur Anwarganj is the second largest railway station in Kanpur District, Uttar Pradesh, India. ==Structure and layout== It has three platforms. It was constructed during the British Raj. It has one big clock on its main building. It is on the Farrukhabad-Kanpur line. Until 2006 it was a metre gauge station. In 2006 Railway Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav reopened the line as a broad gauge railway line towards Lucknow. The first station superintendent was Mr. V.N. Pandey. In 2008 a broad gauge line opened towards Mathura too. ==Services== Kanpur Anwarganj serves trains of Lucknow-Kanpur Suburban Railway to reduce pressure on Kanpur Central. Around 45 trains pass through the station. Some MEMU trains start from here.http://in.jagran.yahoo.com/epaper/index.php?location=30&edition;=2010-04-26&pageno;=7 Kanpur Anwarganj is now linked with some new stations like New Delhi, Mathura, Agra, Jaipur, Gorakhpur, Chapra, Patna, Kolkata, etc. Now Kanpur Anwarganj is one of the main railway station on the route to Rajasthan and Eastern India. ==Trains originating== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="background:#ffffff;" |- ! style="background-color:#FFD700" | Train Number !! style="background-color:#FFD700" | Train Name !! style="background- color:#FFD700" | Arrival !! style="background-color:#FFD700" | Departure !! style="background-color:#FFD700" | Destination/ Origin !! style="background-color:#FFD700" | Days !! style="background- color:#FFD700" | Platform No. |- | align="left" | 5003 | align="left" | Chauri Chaura Express | align="left" | — | align="left" | 16:45 | align="left" | Gorakhpur | align="left" | Daily | align="left" | Platform No.1 |- | align="left" | 5004 | align="left" | Chauri Chaura Express | align="left" | 12:10 | align="left" | — | align="left" | Gorakhpur Junction | align="left" | Daily | align="left" | Platform No.1 |- | align="left" | 8191 | align="left" | Utsarg Express | align="left" | 09:45 | align="left" | — | align="left" | Chhapra | align="left" | Daily | align="left" | Platform No.3 |- | align="left" | 8192 | align="left" | Utsarg Express | align="left" | — | align="left" | 16:25 | align="left" | Chhapra | align="left" | Daily | align="left" | Platform No.3 |} ==See also== *Kanpur Central *Kanpur Bridge Left Bank *Lucknow-Kanpur Suburban Railway ==References== ==External links== Category:Railway stations in Kanpur Category:Allahabad railway division Category:Railway stations opened in 1896
